meanings.definition: Abnormal cells that have the potential to develop into cancer.
meanings.sent1: Regular check-ups can help detect precancers early.
meanings.sent2: Doctors often monitor precancers closely to prevent cancer.
meanings.sent3: The precancers in the body were like tiny troublemakers causing mischief.
meanings.sent4: She saw the precancers as ticking time bombs waiting to explode.
meanings.sent5: The image of precancers multiplying rapidly haunted her dreams.

meanings.definition: Conditions or factors that increase the risk of developing cancer.
meanings.sent1: Avoiding smoking is crucial to reduce exposure to precancers.
meanings.sent2: A healthy lifestyle can lower the chances of developing precancers.
meanings.sent3: The precancers lurking in the environment played a risky game of chance.
meanings.sent4: Neglecting regular screenings is like inviting precancers to a party.
meanings.sent5: The shadow of precancers loomed ominously over his family history.
